comments:
After installing a fresh (!) Eclipse 3.2 version (wtp-all-in-one) and updating the TPTP plugin, I tried profiling the last running project, but just got a error message window:

---------------
java.lang.NullPointerException
null

java.lang.NullPointerException
  at org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.launcher.ProfilingSetsManager$1.compare(ProfilingSetsManager.java:800)
  at java.util.Arrays.mergeSort(Arrays.java:1284)
  at java.util.Arrays.sort(Arrays.java:1223)
  at java.util.Collections.sort(Collections.java:159)
  at org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.launcher.ProfilingSetsManager.getProfileOptions(ProfilingSetsManager.java:797)
  at org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.launcher.ProfilingSetsManager.getOptions(ProfilingSetsManager.java:719)
  at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.internal.launcher.deleg.application.PIDelegateHelper.createAgent(PIDelegateHelper.java:55)
  at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.internal.launcher.deleg.application.PIJavaLauncherDelegate.createAgent(PIJavaLauncherDelegate.java:35)
  at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.provisional.launcher.PrimaryLaunchDelegate.run(PrimaryLaunchDelegate.java:309)
  at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:595)
---------------------

Can you include the exact steps for reproducing this problem?
I'm not able to reproduce the NPE.

Can you tell me the analysis types that you've selected?  Go to the profile launch configuration > select your launch item > select the "Monitor" tab >  list the items that are checked.

Thanks.
*** Bug 152337 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Ali,

Did you try using the wtp-all-in-one zip file?  It doesn't sound like the submitter has downloaded all the TPTP pre-requisites, but is rather relying on WTP's al in one packge.  I wonder if this is a packaging problem with WTP?
I tried downloading wtp-all-in-one package and adding TPTP SDK 4.2.0.1 and everything seemed to work fine on my machine (with and without AC).

I didn't install TPTP separately (by downloading it and installing it in the existing eclipse directory) but by using Eclipse' update manager, checking TPTP and finished the install process (including restart of eclipse).

Here's what I did:

- Download wtp-all-in-one from http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/drops/R1.5/R-1.5.0-200606281455/
- Started the eclipse workbench
- Selected Help > Software Updates > Find and Install
- Search for new features > Next > Callisto Discovery Site > Finish > See the snap shot for the package selections > Finish > Restarted workbench
- I then tried to profile an "External Java Application" > It worked as expected
- I tried creating a Java project with a Main class.  I right clicked the main class and selected Profile As > Java Application > Execution Time Analysis > Profile > Worked as expected.

I have no idea what you're doing to cause the NPE exception.

Created an attachment (id=47148)
Package selection snapshot
I'm returning this as "worksforme" unless you can provide me with steps for consistenly reproducing this problem.
Well, I can't tell you more. But you can see in the stack trace where the problem is: line 800 in ProfilingSetsManager. Just check for null and show an error message.
